name: Quick and Easy Buffalo Tofu Appetizer
author: Afields
summary: This is a great vegetarian substitute for buffalo wings; it's also much more affordable than buying chicken wings, and meat eaters love it too. If you want to spend more time on it, you can make your own sauce and breadcrumbs, but I'm often looking for a quick potluck meal, and this is an easy, fast recipe that always gets great reviews.
ingredients: 1 cup bread crumbs, or more as needed
olive oil, or more as needed
1 (12 ounce) bottle Buffalo-style hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's®)
½ cup blue cheese salad dressing  (Optional)
directions: Place tofu onto a plate and place another plate on top
Set a 3 to 5 pound weight on top; press tofu until water is extracted and tofu is firmer, about 15 minutes
Drain and discard the accumulated liquid
Slice tofu into 1-inch wide by 4-inch long pieces
Whisk egg in a small bowl
Pour breadcrumbs into separate shallow bowl
Dip tofu pieces into beaten egg and press into bread crumbs
Gently toss between your hands so any bread crumbs that haven't stuck can fall away
Place the breaded tofu pieces onto a plate while breading the rest; do not stack
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Fry tofu in a single layer, browning completely on each side before turning, about 3 minutes per side
Place fried tofu on serving platter
Combine hot pepper sauce and butter in a bowl; pour over fried tofu
Serve with blue cheese dressing and celery pieces
